Events.year: 351 – The Jewish revolt against Constantius Gallus breaks out after his arrival at Antioch.[1]
Events.html: 351 – The Jewish revolt against Constantius Gallus breaks out after his arrival at Antioch.[1]

Events.year: 558 – In Constantinople, the dome of the Hagia Sophia collapses, twenty years after its construction.[2] Justinian I immediately orders that the dome be rebuilt.
Events.html: 558 – In Constantinople, the dome of the Hagia Sophia collapses, twenty years after its construction.[2] Justinian I immediately orders that the dome be rebuilt.

Events.year: 1274 – In France, the Second Council of Lyon opens to regulate the election of the Pope.
Events.html: 1274 – In France, the Second Council of Lyon opens to regulate the election of the Pope.

Events.year: 1487 – The Siege of Málaga commences during the Spanish Reconquista.
Events.html: 1487 – The Siege of Málaga commences during the Spanish Reconquista.

Events.year: 1664 – Louis XIV of France begins construction of the Palace of Versailles.
Events.html: 1664 – Louis XIV of France begins construction of the Palace of Versailles.

Events.year: 1685 – Battle of Vrtijeljka between rebels and Ottoman forces.
Events.html: 1685 – Battle of Vrtijeljka between rebels and Ottoman forces.

Events.year: 1697 – Stockholm's royal castle (dating back to medieval times) is destroyed by fire. It is replaced in the 18th century by the current Royal Palace.
Events.html: 1697 – Stockholm's royal castle (dating back to medieval times) is destroyed by fire. It is replaced in the 18th century by the current Royal Palace.

Events.year: 1718 – The city of New Orleans is founded by Jean-Baptiste Le Moyne, Sieur de Bienville.
Events.html: 1718 – The city of New Orleans is founded by Jean-Baptiste Le Moyne, Sieur de Bienville.

links.title: Jean-Baptiste Le Moyne, Sieur de Bienville

Events.year: 1763 – Pontiac's War begins with Pontiac's attempt to seize Fort Detroit from the British.
Events.html: 1763 – Pontiac's War begins with Pontiac's attempt to seize Fort Detroit from the British.

Events.year: 1794 – French Revolution: Robespierre introduces the Cult of the Supreme Being in the National Convention as the new state religion of the French First Republic.
Events.html: 1794 – French Revolution: Robespierre introduces the Cult of the Supreme Being in the National Convention as the new state religion of the French First Republic.

Events.year: 1824 – World premiere of Ludwig van Beethoven's Ninth Symphony in Vienna, Austria. The performance is conducted by Michael Umlauf under the composer's supervision.
Events.html: 1824 – World premiere of Ludwig van Beethoven's Ninth Symphony in Vienna, Austria. The performance is conducted by Michael Umlauf under the composer's supervision.

Events.year: 1832 – Greece's independence is recognized by the Treaty of London.
Events.html: 1832 – Greece's independence is recognized by the Treaty of London.

Events.year: 1840 – The Great Natchez Tornado strikes Natchez, Mississippi killing 317 people. It is the second deadliest tornado in United States history.
Events.html: 1840 – The Great Natchez Tornado strikes Natchez, Mississippi killing 317 people. It is the second deadliest tornado in United States history.

Events.year: 1846 – The Cambridge Chronicle, America's oldest surviving weekly newspaper, is published for the first time in Cambridge, Massachusetts.
Events.html: 1846 – The Cambridge Chronicle, America's oldest surviving weekly newspaper, is published for the first time in Cambridge, Massachusetts.

Events.year: 1864 – American Civil War: The Army of the Potomac, under General Ulysses S. Grant, breaks off from the Battle of the Wilderness and moves southwards.
Events.html: 1864 – American Civil War: The Army of the Potomac, under General Ulysses S. Grant, breaks off from the Battle of the Wilderness and moves southwards.

Events.year: 1864   – The world's oldest surviving clipper ship, the City of Adelaide is launched by William Pile, Hay and Co. in Sunderland, England, for transporting passengers and goods between Britain and Australia.
Events.html: 1864 – The world's oldest surviving clipper ship, the City of Adelaide is launched by William Pile, Hay and Co. in Sunderland, England, for transporting passengers and goods between Britain and Australia.

Events.year: 1895 – In Saint Petersburg, Russian scientist Alexander Stepanovich Popov demonstrates to the Russian Physical and Chemical Society his invention, the Popov lightning detector—a primitive radio receiver. In some parts of the former Soviet Union the anniversary of this day is celebrated as Radio Day.
Events.html: 1895 – In Saint Petersburg, Russian scientist Alexander Stepanovich Popov demonstrates to the Russian Physical and Chemical Society his invention, the Popov lightning detector—a primitive radio receiver. In some parts of the former Soviet Union the anniversary of this day is celebrated as Radio Day.

Events.year: 1915 – World War I: German submarine U-20 sinks RMS Lusitania, killing 1,198 people, including 128 Americans. Public reaction to the sinking turns many former pro-Germans in the United States against the German Empire.
Events.html: 1915 – World War I: German submarine U-20 sinks RMS Lusitania, killing 1,198 people, including 128 Americans. Public reaction to the sinking turns many former pro-Germans in the United States against the German Empire.

Events.year: 1915   – The Republic of China accedes to 13 of the 21 Demands, extending the Empire of Japan's control over Manchuria and the Chinese economy.[3]
Events.html: 1915 – The Republic of China accedes to 13 of the 21 Demands, extending the Empire of Japan's control over Manchuria and the Chinese economy.[3]

Events.year: 1920 – Kiev Offensive: Polish troops led by Józef Piłsudski and Edward Rydz-Śmigły and assisted by a symbolic Ukrainian force capture Kiev only to be driven out by the Red Army counter-offensive a month later.
Events.html: 1920 – Kiev Offensive: Polish troops led by Józef Piłsudski and Edward Rydz-Śmigły and assisted by a symbolic Ukrainian force capture Kiev only to be driven out by the Red Army counter-offensive a month later.

Events.year: 1920   – Treaty of Moscow: Soviet Russia recognizes the independence of the Democratic Republic of Georgia only to invade the country six months later.
Events.html: 1920 – Treaty of Moscow: Soviet Russia recognizes the independence of the Democratic Republic of Georgia only to invade the country six months later.

Events.year: 1930 – The 7.1 Mw  Salmas earthquake shakes northwestern Iran and southeastern Turkey with a maximum Mercalli intensity of IX (Violent). Up to three-thousand people were killed.
Events.html: 1930 – The 7.1 Mw  Salmas earthquake shakes northwestern Iran and southeastern Turkey with a maximum Mercalli intensity of IX (Violent). Up to three-thousand people were killed.

Events.year: 1931 – The stand-off between criminal Francis Crowley and 300 members of the New York Police Department takes place in his fifth-floor apartment on West 91st Street, New York City.
Events.html: 1931 – The stand-off between criminal Francis Crowley and 300 members of the New York Police Department takes place in his fifth-floor apartment on West 91st Street, New York City.

Events.year: 1937 – Spanish Civil War: The German Condor Legion, equipped with Heinkel He 51 biplanes, arrives in Spain to assist Francisco Franco's forces.
Events.html: 1937 – Spanish Civil War: The German Condor Legion, equipped with Heinkel He 51 biplanes, arrives in Spain to assist Francisco Franco's forces.

Events.year: 1940 – World War II: The Norway Debate in the British House of Commons begins, and leads to the replacement of Prime Minister Neville Chamberlain with Winston Churchill three days later.
Events.html: 1940 – World War II: The Norway Debate in the British House of Commons begins, and leads to the replacement of Prime Minister Neville Chamberlain with Winston Churchill three days later.

Events.year: 1942 – World War II: During the Battle of the Coral Sea, United States Navy aircraft carrier aircraft attack and sink the Imperial Japanese Navy light aircraft carrier Shōhō; the battle marks the first time in naval history that two enemy fleets fight without visual contact between warring ships.
Events.html: 1942 – World War II: During the Battle of the Coral Sea, United States Navy aircraft carrier aircraft attack and sink the Imperial Japanese Navy light aircraft carrier Shōhō; the battle marks the first time in naval history that two enemy fleets fight without visual contact between warring ships.

Events.year: 1945 – World War II: Last German U boat attack of the war, two freighters are sunk off the Firth of Forth, Scotland.
Events.html: 1945 – World War II: Last German U boat attack of the war, two freighters are sunk off the Firth of Forth, Scotland.

Events.year: 1945 – World War II: General Alfred Jodl signs unconditional surrender terms at Reims, France, ending Germany's participation in the war. The document takes effect the next day.
Events.html: 1945 – World War II: General Alfred Jodl signs unconditional surrender terms at Reims, France, ending Germany's participation in the war. The document takes effect the next day.

Events.year: 1946 – Tokyo Telecommunications Engineering (later renamed Sony) is founded.[4]
Events.html: 1946 – Tokyo Telecommunications Engineering (later renamed Sony) is founded.[4]

Events.year: 1948 – The Council of Europe is founded during the Hague Congress.
Events.html: 1948 – The Council of Europe is founded during the Hague Congress.

Events.year: 1952 – The concept of the integrated circuit, the basis for all modern computers, is first published by Geoffrey Dummer.
Events.html: 1952 – The concept of the integrated circuit, the basis for all modern computers, is first published by Geoffrey Dummer.

Events.year: 1954 – Indochina War: The Battle of Dien Bien Phu ends in a French defeat and a Viet Minh victory (the battle began on March 13).
Events.html: 1954 – Indochina War: The Battle of Dien Bien Phu ends in a French defeat and a Viet Minh victory (the battle began on March 13).

Events.year: 1960 – Cold War: U-2 Crisis of 1960: Soviet leader Nikita Khrushchev announces that his nation is holding American U-2 pilot Gary Powers.
Events.html: 1960 – Cold War: U-2 Crisis of 1960: Soviet leader Nikita Khrushchev announces that his nation is holding American U-2 pilot Gary Powers.

Events.year: 1976 – The Honda Accord is officially launched.
Events.html: 1976 – The Honda Accord is officially launched.

Events.year: 1986 – Canadian Patrick Morrow becomes the first person to climb each of the Seven Summits.
Events.html: 1986 – Canadian Patrick Morrow becomes the first person to climb each of the Seven Summits.

Events.year: 1992 – Michigan ratifies a 203-year-old proposed amendment to the United States Constitution making the 27th Amendment law. This amendment bars the U.S. Congress from giving itself a mid-term pay raise.
Events.html: 1992 – Michigan ratifies a 203-year-old proposed amendment to the United States Constitution making the 27th Amendment law. This amendment bars the U.S. Congress from giving itself a mid-term pay raise.

links.title: Twenty-seventh Amendment to the United States Constitution

Events.year: 1992   – Space Shuttle program: The Space Shuttle Endeavour is launched on its first mission, STS-49.
Events.html: 1992 – Space Shuttle program: The Space Shuttle Endeavour is launched on its first mission, STS-49.

Events.year: 1992   – Three employees at a McDonald's Restaurant in Sydney, Nova Scotia, Canada, are brutally murdered and a fourth permanently disabled after a botched robbery. It is the first "fast-food murder" in Canada.
Events.html: 1992 – Three employees at a McDonald's Restaurant in Sydney, Nova Scotia, Canada, are brutally murdered and a fourth permanently disabled after a botched robbery. It is the first "fast-food murder" in Canada.

Events.year: 1994 – Edvard Munch's painting The Scream is recovered undamaged after being stolen from the National Gallery of Norway in February.[5]
Events.html: 1994 – Edvard Munch's painting The Scream is recovered undamaged after being stolen from the National Gallery of Norway in February.[5]

Events.year: 1998 – Mercedes-Benz buys Chrysler for US$40 billion USD and forms DaimlerChrysler in the largest industrial merger in history.[6]
Events.html: 1998 – Mercedes-Benz buys Chrysler for US$40 billion USD and forms DaimlerChrysler in the largest industrial merger in history.[6]

Events.year: 1999 – Pope John Paul II travels to Romania, becoming the first pope to visit a predominantly Eastern Orthodox country since the Great Schism in 1054.
Events.html: 1999 – Pope John Paul II travels to Romania, becoming the first pope to visit a predominantly Eastern Orthodox country since the Great Schism in 1054.

Events.year: 1999   – Kosovo War: Three Chinese citizens are killed and 20 wounded when a NATO aircraft apparently inadvertently bombs the Chinese embassy in Belgrade, Serbia.
Events.html: 1999 – Kosovo War: Three Chinese citizens are killed and 20 wounded when a NATO aircraft apparently inadvertently bombs the Chinese embassy in Belgrade, Serbia.

links.title: United States bombing of the Chinese embassy in Belgrade

Events.year: 1999   – In Guinea-Bissau, President João Bernardo Vieira is ousted in a military coup.
Events.html: 1999 – In Guinea-Bissau, President João Bernardo Vieira is ousted in a military coup.

Events.year: 2000 – Vladimir Putin is inaugurated as president of Russia.
Events.html: 2000 – Vladimir Putin is inaugurated as president of Russia.

Events.year: 2002 – A China Northern Airlines MD-82 plunges into the Yellow Sea, killing 112 people.
Events.html: 2002 – A China Northern Airlines MD-82 plunges into the Yellow Sea, killing 112 people.

Events.year: 2004 – American businessman Nick Berg is beheaded by Islamic militants. The act is recorded on videotape and released on the Internet.[7]
Events.html: 2004 – American businessman Nick Berg is beheaded by Islamic militants. The act is recorded on videotape and released on the Internet.[7]
